bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie B. Lawrence, April 13, 1876

div1.p: Reed is ordered to San Francisco. He will visit Emilie Lawrence with a “startling request.”

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie B. Lawrence, April 13, 1876
div1.p:
Well, the
orders, which I have been
so anxiously awaiting, have
arrived- I am ordered to
accompany a detachment
of Soldiers to San Francis-
co, & then to report to the
General commanding the
Department of Arizona
for assignment to duty.
I will be placed on wait-
ing orders for a period
of 4 weeks, more or less-
& as the Detachment will
not start till that time-
I shall remain at home
during this time -- will leave
New York for Norfolk
next Monday -- & probably
get to Murfreesboro on
Wednesday or Thursday-
Be prepared for a very
startling request, when
I do arrive, for if I go
to Arizona, I cannot
return for 3 or 4 years,
& to be separated from
you, my sweet, for that length of
time cannot be entertained.
